awd_abstract_narration: The proposed research will involve theoretical studies of a                     variety of different kinds of reaction between fluid and rock.                  It will include:                                                                1.  Gravitational instabilities ranging from situations of rapid                melt segregation to cases in which segregation is slow or                       negligible                                                                      2.  Chemical exchange balanced by diffusion in the fluid phase:                 An application of this regime is the exchange of Sr between                     carbonates and their contained porewaters.                                      3   Exchange limited by diffusion in the solid phase.  The                      thermal history in the vicinity of the conduit at Inyo Domes is                 sufficiently well known that it should be possible to determine                 the diffusion parameters of feldspars in their natural setting,                 and compare it to laboratory diffusion data to test the key                     assumption of thermochronometry that laboratory data can indeed                 be extrapolated to give geologically relevant diffusion rates.
